blurb: Haxe is an open source high-level strictly-typed programming language with a fast optimizing cross-compiler. Haxe can build cross-platform applications targeting JavaScript, C++, C#, Java, JVM, Python, Lua, PHP, Flash, and allows access to each platform's native capabilities. Haxe has its own VMs (HashLink and NekoVM) but can also run in interpreted mode. Code written in Haxe can be compiled to any target Haxe supports.

key_features.title: Cross-platform
key_features.content: Cross-compile to 14 targets, including Javascript, PHP7, C++, Lua, the JVM, and the HashLink VM.

key_features.title: Multi-paradigm
key_features.content: Haxe supports OOP, metaprogramming, and many functional features.

key_features.title: Advanced type system
key_features.content: A robust and sohpisticated type system with type inference, generics, abstracts, and much more.

key_features.title: General purpose
key_features.content: Haxe excels in game development but is used in many domains, including web, mobile, and desktop.

key_features.title: Native access
key_features.content: Externs enable type-safe interaction with the underlying target, providing access to native APIs.

key_features.title: Metaprogramming
key_features.content: Syntax-transformation using macros unlocks the power to fit the language to your problem domain.
